text: In Greek mythology, Iphiclus (, Iphiklos) was the name of the following figures: *Iphiclus, was other name for Iphicles, son of Alcmene and Amphitryon. * Iphiclus, was the son of Thestius and either LaophonteScholiast on Apollonius of Rhodes, Argonautica 1.146 with Alcman, fr. 15 as authority, LeucippeHyginus, Fabulae 14, DeidameiaApollonius Rhodius, Argonautica 1.201 or EurythemisPseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1.8.3. He was the brother of Althaea, Leda, Hypermnestra, Evippus, Plexippus and Eurypylus. Iphitus was one of the ArgonautsOrphic Argonautica', 158Valerius Flaccus, Argonautica 1.370Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1.9.16, and a participant in the hunt for the Calydonian Boar, where he was killed by Meleager. *Iphiclus, a Thessalonian man, son of Phylacus and Clymene, brother of Alcimede and Clymenus. He was described by Hesiod as fleet of foot. He was the father of Protesilaus, Podarces by Diomedeia.Homer, Iliad 2.704-706 & 13.698Hyginus, Fabulae 103 Iphiclus was cured of infertility by Melampus, and gave him his famous herd of oxen in reward.Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1.9.12 He is counted among the Argonauts who sailed for Colchis in their quest of the Golden Fleece.Apollonius Rhodius, Argonautica 1.23–228Valerius Flaccus, Argonautica 1.370 * Iphiclus, son of Idomeneus of Crete. == Notes == == References == * Apollonius Rhodius, Argonautica translated by Robert Cooper Seaton (1853-1915), R.
